alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason; Menard (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:45PM CST until January 31 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Oakford affecting Cass, Mason and Menard Counties. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. There have been reports of ice jam movement in the vicinity, including a potential jam release upstream near Petersburg. Expect rapid fluctuations of 1-5 ft in river stage, with a re-rise to minor flood likely. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Oakford. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 471.0 feet, Flooding begins to agricultural areas not protected by levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 470.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 472.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 471.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Sangamon River Oakford 471.0 470.6 Fri 7 pm CST 471.8 471.9 471.5 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
